Here's everything you need to know for Saturday's third-round action at the 86th Masters at Augusta National Golf Club:
Tiger 'back into the ballgame': Woods heads into the weekend at Masters | Opinion
What TV channel will broadcast the Masters on Saturday?
Live action from the third round of the Masters can be live streamed at Masters.com, the Masters app, ESPN+, Paramount+, CBSSports.com and the CBS Sports app, beginning Saturday at 10:15 a.m.
The 86th Masters Tournament is heading into the third round of action on Saturday and only the top 50 players, including ties, have made the cut into the weekend.
He will begin the third round on Saturday five strokes ahead of second place, tied for the largest lead in Masters history after 36 holes.
The five-time Masters champion shot 2-over 74 in his second round Friday despite his worst start ever at Augusta National Golf Club.
Saturday's expected forecast for Augusta, Georgia, calls for a high of 58 degrees, with mostly sunny skies.
Winds are expected out of the west at 6 to 15 mph, with gusts of up to 17 mph in the afternoon.
